result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BATT/THREAT TO LEO, RESIST/OBSTR, DC, BAIL JUMP - MISD
CONDITIONS:    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL.  Defendant shall not enter any establishment in which their primary purpose is the sale of alcohol;  DO NOT OPERATE A MOTOR VEHICLE WITHOUT A VALID LICENSE.  COMPLY WITH CONDITIONS OF THE ALCOHOL 24/7 PROGRAM. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing. THE DEFENDANT SHALL BRING THE ALCOHOL MONITORING DEVICE TO EVERY HEARING.

02:49 PM Defendant SCOTT C ROBINSON in court with attorney Ryan S Van Ells.  Defendant SCOTT C ROBINSON in custody.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SCOTT C ROBINSON appeared by video means with Attorney.    Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender.  Given rights to an attorney.  The Court notes there is no victim present to make a statement.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  Record closed @ 2:55  Further proceedings scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
